it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller.weapons.targets

Class AbstractTarget

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.polimi.deib.se2019.sanp4.adrenaline.controller.weapons.targets.AbstractTarget
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    RadiusTarget, RoomTarget, SingleSquareTarget, VortexTarget

    public abstract class AbstractTarget
extends Object
    Abstract class representing a target of a TargetingEffect.

    It represents a player or a group of players (e.g. in the same room, square) that receive the same amount of damage and marks.

    Provides various attributes and methods which can be used by subclasses.

    The filters which have a common meaning between subclasses are:
    • optional: an optional target might be executed or not, this won't impact on the correct execution of the effect
    • damage: The amount of damage that will be received by all targeted players
    • marks: The amount of marks that will be received by all targeted players
    Author:
    Alessandro Fulgini

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractTarget

        public AbstractTarget(String id,
                      AbstractWeapon weapon,
                      Match match,
                      ControllerFactory factory)
        Creates a new abstract target associated to the given weapon. While the id is set on initialization, the other properties receive their default values, which can be changed later by using setters.
        Parameters:
        id - The unique identifier of this target in its effect, not null
        weapon - The weapon controller associated to this target, not null
        match - The match which has to be controlled, not null
        factory - The factory to create needed controllers, not null

      • isOptional

        public boolean isOptional()
        Returns whether this target is optional or not
        Returns:
        true if this target is optional, false otherwise

      • setOptional

        public void setOptional(boolean optional)
        Sets this weapon's optional attribute. If set to true, then the user won't be obliged to shoot this target while using the weapon. Default value is false.
        Parameters:
        optional - The desired value of the attribute

        Parameters:

      • getExcludePlayers

        public Set<String> getExcludePlayers()
        Returns the set of players which have to be excluded from selection for this target. The players are represented by the ids of their targets in the current weapon.
        Returns:
        A set of ids representing the players to exclude

      • setExcludePlayers

        public void setExcludePlayers(Set<String> excludePlayers)
        Sets the set of players which have to be excluded from selection for this target. The players are represented by the ids of their targets in the current weapon.
        Parameters:
        excludePlayers - The set of ids representing the players to exclude, not null

      • getExcludeSquares

        public Set<String> getExcludeSquares()
        Returns the set of squares which have to be excluded from selection for this target. The squares are represented by the ids of their targets in the current weapon.
        Returns:
        A set of ids representing the squares to exclude

      • setExcludeSquares

        public void setExcludeSquares(Set<String> excludeSquares)
        Sets the set of squares which have to be excluded from selection for this target. The squares are represented by the ids of their targets in the current weapon.
        Parameters:
        excludeSquares - The set of ids representing the squares to exclude, not null

      • determineUntargetablePlayers

        protected Set<Player> determineUntargetablePlayers(Player shooter)
        Returns a set of players who can't be targeted for the following reasons: explicitly excluded, or because he's the shooter.
        Parameters:
        shooter - The player using the weapon, not null
        Returns:
        The set of players who can't be targeted

      • applyDamageAndMarks

        protected void applyDamageAndMarks(Player target,
                                   Player shooter)
        Applies the damages and marks to the selected target and saves it among damaged players in the weapon. Does not check if the target is targetable or not.
        Parameters:
        target - The target player, not null
        shooter - The player using the weapon, not null

      • execute

        public abstract boolean execute(PersistentView view)
                         throws InterruptedException
        Executes this target given the user of the weapon
        Parameters:
        view - The view of the player using the weapon
        Returns:
        true if the player chose his target and was able to perform damage/marks false if the player chose not to use the target
        Throws:
        CancellationException - if a request to the user gets cancelled
        InterruptedException - if the thread gets interrupted
